intro: Xanthochymus madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar yellowwood, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, simple leaves, and small, yellowish flowers. It is often found in dry forests and scrublands, adapting to the arid conditions of its native habitat. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
